p.k: We have François Couperin to thank for some of the most stunning pages found in 18th-century harpsichord literature. Today, Aurélien Delage tackles the encyclopedic first volume of his 220 solo works – the calling card of a musical all-rounder.
p.d: We have François Couperin to thank for some of the most stunning pages found in 18th-century harpsichord literature. Numbering more than 220 solo pieces, his four collections contain much of Couperin's finest work. We found four keyboard heroes, each of whom was free to browse through his or her favourite volume. Today Aurélien Delage tackles the encyclopedic first volume – the calling card of a musical all-rounder.
